TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . DATE the applicant was the leader of the drivers ' trade union of a bread - making company in GPE . He was also a member of ORG ( “ GPE ” , PERSON Ţărănesc creştin şi NORP ) . On DATE his work contract was terminated on disciplinary grounds .

CARDINAL . NORP In the DATE issue of the DATE local journal PERSON published an article under the heading : “ The snake within the GPE – because of him , PERSON was almost left without bread ” ( GPE din sânul GPE – din cauza PERSON era să rămână fără pâine ) in which he accused the applicant mainly of maintaining an ungrounded conflict with the company 's management , of harassing and defaming its director , of having repeatedly neglected his work duties alleging trade union needs and of having jeopardised bread distribution in PERSON in pursuit of his personal goals .
The relevant parts of the article read as follows :
“ ... Through his actions – lying , defaming and falsifying DATE he does nothing but undermine the GPE 's credibility ... That is why PERSON may be called , without hesitation :
The snake within the GPE

Paradoxically , sometimes bad faith comes from within the trade unions . I say this because the conflict between an uninspired trade union leader and the management of [ the bread - making company in GPE ] jeopardised the bread supply of the inhabitants of GPE on several occasions . ”
The article was accompanied by the applicant 's photograph and several documents issued by the employer or the trade union concerning the applicant 's activity .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a criminal complaint with the ORG against ORG , the director of PERSON , and GPE , its chief editor . He accused them of having damaged his reputation by publishing that article . He sought CARDINAL NORP Lei ( ROL ) in respect of nonpecuniary damage .

CARDINAL . DATE and DATE , LOC held several hearings in the case . However , it could not examine the case , as GPE had not been properly identified and summoned ( according to the applicant , another person with the same name had been summoned to appear in court instead ) . In addition , the applicant claimed that on DATE the court had informed him that the next hearing would take place on DATE , whereas in reality the court had met on DATE , and thus he was not able to participate in the court hearing . He was present at the other hearings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court sent the case to ORG and asked it to identify the accused GPE
CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor sent the case back with the information requested and it was registered in the ORG list of cases again .
CARDINAL . The applicant complained CARDINAL times against the judges or prosecutors , asking them to step down . His requests were all dismissed .
CARDINAL . The parties were heard and documents were adduced . The applicant claimed that the court had refused to hear his witness and had not asked for additional evidence .

CARDINAL . The court gave judgment on DATE . It acquitted the journalists and dismissed the applicant 's claim for damages . It also ordered the applicant to pay ROL CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL to the ORG in respect of costs incurred in the proceedings .

CARDINAL . It noted that GPE had written the article in good faith , had based it on documents provided by ORG and information available in other press articles previously published on the subject , and had checked the facts by means of a journalistic investigation . Furthermore , the applicant had failed to prove that the journalists had acted with the intent to defame him .

CARDINAL . The applicant appealed , arguing notably that the court 's decision contradicted the evidence in the file , that the court had not examined the offensive language used in the article , had not given reasons for rejecting the civil claims and had unlawfully ordered him to pay the costs incurred by the ORG . He also requested that the court declare null and void an interlocutory judgment by means of which ORG upheld a request by CARDINAL of the judges to be allowed to step down from the case .

CARDINAL . In addition , on DATE he also lodged a constitutional complaint against the order to pay costs . On DATE the complaint was dismissed as unfounded by ORG , on the ground that justice was not free of charge and that court fees did not as such restrict or deny access to court , as in any case the authorities were bound to investigate and decide on the case even when the parties refused to cover the expenses .
CARDINAL . In a final decision of CARDINAL DATE ORG upheld the judgment .

CARDINAL . ORG had examined the applicant 's arguments one by one . In essence , it found that the first - instance court had correctly interpreted the facts and the evidence in the file and considered that the reasons given for acquitting the journalists constituted relevant justification for dismissing the civil claim . It also considered that the complaints against the interlocutory judgment and against the obligation to reimburse the costs were unfounded .
